item.title: ðŸŽ‰ Joined the University of Houston as a PhD student
item.description:
Hi everyone, I’m starting my PhD journey at the University of Houston. I’m excited to be part of the UH-D2i-group under the supervision of Professor Jingchao Ni.

My research focuses on applying machine learning and data science methods for time series prediction and anomaly detection. I am also exploring data science techniques to uncover causal relationships across various fields and develop new methods for causal discovery. Additionally, I am interested in integrating language and vision models through multimodal learning to tackle challenges in time series analysis and causal discovery.

I’m looking forward to working with you all!

item.title: ðŸš€ A Brand New Personal Homepage!
item.description:
In the upcoming Fall of 2024, I will be completing my undergraduate studies and beginning my Ph.D. journey. To better present my academic experience and personal information, I have used Hugo to create a new personal homepage (which is the page you are currently viewing)!

I will continue to update my academic blog and personal news on this homepage. Stay tuned!

More information about me can be found in Bio. I sincerely hope my posts can help you. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.
